intro: Taonabo maltbyi, commonly known as the Malteby's taonabo, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy, and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has adapted to the specific microclimate of its habitat. Its conservation status is critically endangered due to habitat loss and over-collection. Researchers are studying its genetic makeup to aid in conservation efforts and potential cultivation.
